website_summaries.verdict: The Powermat isn't entirely free of wires, but it succeeds at being different and at powering your phone. On the other hand, we don't see it fulfilling a need.
pros: The Powermat successfully charges your phone without a wired connection
cons: The Powermat won't work with every handset, and you'll need to pay extra to charge more than one device simultaneously

customer_reviews.title: Watch the Format QI
customer_reviews.text: I found learning the hard way there is several formats, QI is the most popular and then there is power mat. I have a phone that is QI enabled and does not work with powermat. I learned that there was more than one format the hard way the poduct works great , but just not for my phone the bad reviews her is due to people not understanding the technology realizing the charger does not work unless the you add the back cover design for you device or use the include device to plug into you device. So becareful and make sure you order the right format for you device
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great concept. Maybe the next generation will truly be useful.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize all my phones would need an attachment that bulked them up. Even when I bought the attachments and downloaded the app, I still couldn't get it to work without plugging in and that was the whole point of getting it, so I wouldn't have to plug in.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This device is a great idea, but it does not fully charge my ...
customer_reviews.text: This device is a great idea, but it does not fully charge my phone. When I plug it into the wall. using the charger provided by the manufacturer, it gets the full charge it needs. BTW: my phone is an HTC, not some off brand.
customer_reviews.author: Eat-5

customer_reviews.title: power pad
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this product was very appealing. I bought it for my husband for his birthday. He also was very pleased with the product but we were both quickly disappointed. When he opened it and tried to use it and we realized that in order to use the product, we needed to spend almost another additional $100 on receivers and adapters to make the power mat truely wireless. This was not made clear to me at all at this time of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Broken and missing parts
customer_reviews.text: As I said above, it was broken and missing many parts. All it had was the mat and the charger cord. I had the correct wireless charger adapter on my phone but it just would not charge. All the did was occasionally blink lights.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Of the four charging doors I bought none of them work as directed. I have yet to be able to charge a phone.
customer_reviews.author: JASON

customer_reviews.title: didn't work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I only bought for one reason, which was to inductively charge my Google nexus 4. I did a lot of research on the company website and various websites. It appeared that it would work, however, it didn't. Product doesn't work w qi standard. It has its own standard and I'm not sure what phones work on it. You would think the company would keep a list on their website.
customer_reviews.author: tex2008

customer_reviews.title: Could have been great...
customer_reviews.text: ...until I realized that they don't even make the battery doors for my particular phone yet. It's really just a charging station until you make the purchases to turn your items into compatible devices for the wireless capability. Just wasn't what I was expecting but I've been too lazy to return it, so $25 down the drain. Should have read through the reviews as I always do - lesson learned!
customer_reviews.author: Celeste S.

customer_reviews.title: powermat
customer_reviews.text: it really doesnt hold a charge well, but i didnt pay alot for it, so you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Powermat Rocks
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a Power Mat and I love it. There is room for phones and IPods so that everything gets charged at one location and we are not always looking for power cords. Reviews I read were not very positive, but I like the powermat and it works for my family. We all use it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Stamm

customer_reviews.title: An okay product, but entirely misleading advertising.
customer_reviews.text: Have to purchase a "power station" for each device you charge, only $40 per device (!). Guess what, they don't make one for Motorola Droid. The included "powercube" is handy and works with many devices via the enclosed tips for charging, but you do have to plug these in, so what have you gained? It does looks nice on the desktop, and is better than ugly dangly cords everywhere, can charge up to 4 devices at once. But I have a hard time recommending it, especially in light of the misleading advertising.
customer_reviews.author: David K. Lenser

customer_reviews.title: Powermat
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two powermats as a gifts for my son and my daughter. They both have new android II cell phones and were unable to get the phones to charge on the mat. My son returned the item to me and my daughter kept hers to use with other items she had. The powermat is a good consept to eliminate multiple chargers and their cords. Just wish it supported the new android II phones.
customer_reviews.author: nbea

customer_reviews.title: Powermat USA
customer_reviews.text: Can't use it on an iPhone. Can't use it with a cover on the phone. It was sent promptly, however these limitations need to be more obviously noted.
customer_reviews.author: JUNE E. SEATON

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit iPhone 5. Need to make those connections part of standard package
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Chrobak

customer_reviews.title: A real rip off
customer_reviews.text: In order to make it work properly, you need to buy extra products.... do not waist your $ on this product and company
customer_reviews.author: Serge Labrie

customer_reviews.title: not good for me, im disappointed !!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZON WAS GREAT WITH DELIVERY AS ALWAYS !!! BUT WHEN I TRY TO USE THIS PRODUCT DIDNT WORK ON ANY OF MY DEVICES :-( I HAVE TO BUY A SEPARATE DEVICE IN ORDER TO MAKE IT WORK. I WILL RECOMMEND NOT TO BUY IT CAUSE IT REALLY DONT WORK. I ALREADY SPEND OVER $100 TO MAKE IT WORK JUST ON MY PHONE !!! MY BLUETOOTH DONT WORK, PORTABLE VIDEO GAME DONT WORK. NOW I HAVE SEND IT BACK AND THATS A PROBLEM CAUSE NOW I HAVE TO WAIT FOR MY MONEY TO BE REFUND, THATS GONNA COST ME TIME AND MONEY. THE WORLD NEED A REAL WIRELESS CHARGING TECHNOLOGY NOT THIS.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: not what I thought it was
customer_reviews.text: So all the commercials and ads show you just simply dropping stuff on this majic pad. easy and great. Nothing shows a reciever for each charging unit. I bought the pad and couldnt for the life of me believe I had to go back and pay another $60 for more recivers??? I can pay $15 for a top quality power strip. What was I thinking.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle N. Mccreight

customer_reviews.title: Power mat home & office mat
customer_reviews.text: This was certainly not worth the money. If you didn't put your item to be charged in exactly the right place it didn't get charged. I returned this item because as far as I was concerned it was too much work with little benefit. It's just a lot easier to plug your item into an outlet than use this.
customer_reviews.author: Bos219

customer_reviews.title: SOMEONE READ PLEASE
customer_reviews.text: I GOT THIS POWERMAT FOR MY BOYFRIEND FOR CHRISTMAS. AND HE CANNOT USE IT BECAUSE THE "DOORS" ARE SOLD SEPERATELY. WELL. WHERE WOULD YOU LIKE ME TO BUY THESE THINGS HMM???? WHAT IS A DOOR? WHY DOESN'T IT COME WITH??? COULD YOU PROVIDE ME WITH A PLACE THAT I CAN BUY ANOTHER PIECE TO THIS EQUIPMENT?? BECAUSE I LOOKED LIKE AN IDIOT. THANKS.
customer_reviews.author: megg

customer_reviews.title: pretty neat... not yet the greatist
customer_reviews.text: There are diffrent plugs that don't fit in the case they give you to go with it... and the pad only hold up to three devises and you have to be sure to place exactly where the magnetic part is.. or it won't charg. Over all... it's cool...
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Castro

customer_reviews.title: Not what you think it is
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife for Christmas- under the misinformation that it is a stand alone product. You need to also buy receivers what go onto the products you are intending to charge. With all of that expense- you might as well get a several pronged electrical adapter and just plug you products in like you normally would. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product as a gift for my father (whose love for new toys is as obvious as most men). He loved it. The only downside was due to my own lack of research: the Powermat was not compatible with the first generation of iPod touch (there is a connection for this type of device, just not a wireless one).
customer_reviews.author: Karli R. Karns

customer_reviews.title: does not work at all
customer_reviews.text: I got this thinking it would be great and come to find out that this thing does not work at all. Big wast of money dont buy
customer_reviews.author: Mrs

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: This product does not do what the package advertises (wireless charging) without having to buy more product . Do not waste your money on this, it is not worth the box it was packaged in.
customer_reviews.author: soke00tielog

customer_reviews.title: This product is false advertising
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because it leads you to believe you will just place your phone or whatever on top of the mat - cool right! WRONG, you need to buy additional cables PLUS you have to plug your phone or device into another little widget AND connect that again, = MORE CORDS. I set mine all up and it didn;t even work after all that. SHAME on you Powermat - this is a B.S. product that does not do what it says it does. G.S.
customer_reviews.author: Gary P. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The mat must be plugged in and is not wireless. Sorry I wasted my money on this piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: scooter0424

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother
customer_reviews.text: This is a bit of a waste. I got it for Christmas and it still requires a powercord to be connected to your device only the other end connects to a charger that sits on the mat instead of plugs into the wall. Not really convenient at all nor different from a regular charger. Further, mine didn't contain the sony tip even though there was a space marked for it - the space was just empty. Really, don't waste your money. This is not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: W. Chilcote

customer_reviews.title: not compatible?
customer_reviews.text: The powermat looks awesome! The powercube is pretty cool, but Powermat is not compatible with the inductive charging that everyone else uses. This will not charge your palm pre, your Nokia Lumia 920, or any other products. They do not use the "QI" standard, dont try to use this with any of the new products coming out.
customer_reviews.author: klinco

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive
customer_reviews.text: Not worth it. Turns out to be "wireless" you have to purchase additional, BULKY, equipment. It includes one so-so adapter but its not worth the aggravation to use it. Bought 4 for my workers but we gave them away.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Universal, but,,,,,....
customer_reviews.text: It has adaptors that work okay, but you might as well use the adapter that your device came with unless your device is equipped to just lay on the mat and get charged.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Walker

customer_reviews.title: have to buy special cases for phones and ipods to work
customer_reviews.text: definitely read the reviews before purchasing this product.. when i did i didn't realize i'd have to buy a special case for my phone and ipods to make the magnetic connection for them to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: liked the idea but didn't work for us
customer_reviews.text: did not work. tried several different phones with receivers. same phones worked on other charger I ordered from amazon. liked the idea but didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.author: sharon smith

customer_reviews.text: Sure saves on the clutter - Everything is charged all of the time....price was right, thanks for solving our power issues.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: This worked half of the time. I'm not impressed at all. Good idea, bad design. I Would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Baker

customer_reviews.title: No more cords
customer_reviews.text: charge up to three devices. many items not supported so you still need adapters with short cords
customer_reviews.author: I. V. Voss

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I saw this on television and was impressed with the idea. Don't waste your money. First of all, you will need to buy more charging holders if you have more than one device. They do not have an adapter for Blackberry, so that does not work. Most importantly, it is hard to get the device to sit and actually charge. Numerous times, it has indicated it is charging over night, only to find out it did not charge at all. Stick to your cords for now.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Cochran

customer_reviews.title: worse with than without
customer_reviews.text: Just echoing the many other one star reviews that, sadly, I read too late. This is as far from wireless as it could possibly be, so it's not clear to me how it can be marketed as it is. As others have pointed out, you actually end up with more wires with this device than you do if you just plug your device into the wall. But, hey, at least you get to pay a lot of money for it! Total waste of a product.
customer_reviews.author: J. White

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with other Qi Devices like Nokia Lumina
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the product is excellent, and if you are using Powermat items it should work nice. However it is NOT QI compatible so it will not work with any other items like Nokia or HTC phones. I tried.
customer_reviews.author: Crabber

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: The Powermat works. The "export" power to your device is not very high and takes a while to charge. Additionally if you have a dead phone, this mat may not charge your phone. Do not throw away your standard chargers.
customer_reviews.author: Boss

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: After receiving the power mat, I was pretty disappointed to find out that it is not all that it is built up to be. Basically used it three to four times before throwing it out
customer_reviews.author: Erik Grossberg

customer_reviews.title: returned power mat
customer_reviews.text: It wasnt' what we thought so we returned it. You still had to plug in charger to the mat, and had to plug in the mat to an outlet. It appeared to be better than that, when we saw it advertised. We were refunded our money. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L. Newlin

customer_reviews.title: Great size. Compact
customer_reviews.text: Great size. Compact. Charges fast. Holds charge till you take it off. Has different chime levels. So many chargeable items I can't begin to say them all
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah Charles

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought
customer_reviews.text: I origionally bought this when the powermat was the talk of the town, it was all over the commercials and all the electronic stores were hip to it. I was so excited to get it, but overall dissapointed. I will say that it does charge your phone pretty fast. its not truly "cordless" and you obviously have to have the powermate case on it all the time, which might I add is a pain and not very easy to take off and on. I would honestly say stick to your normal wall chargers, this isnt worth the money. mine is back in its box collecting dust.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Sandlin

customer_reviews.title: Worthless unit
customer_reviews.text: Unit doesn't work, when I get more time I will review information and try again. It certainly doesn't do what thought from reading the information provide before purchase, but I am only a Engineer and have some trouble some electronic equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Delbert C. Gann

customer_reviews.title: I don't get it
customer_reviews.text: It comes with the 'power cubes' that have a proprietary cord hookup. Maybe I misunderstood the directions but I still had to plug in the cube and lay it on the mat. what is the point of this product. I returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Spadaro

customer_reviews.title: Huge Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item, post haste. It would not charge even one device without using their $30 Powercube. It even shows a DS Lite being effortlessly charged by just dropping it on. It wouldn't even do that! It also would not charge my Nokia phone or Sansa Mp3 player. I know the technology is relatively new and maybe they will get better but for now, I'm still stuck with cords.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Webb

customer_reviews.title: THIS DEVICE IS A JOKE! A WASTE OF MONEY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I PURCHASED THIS DEVICE FROM A COMMERCIAL I SAW ON TELEVISION. I ALSO REVIEWED THE MANUFACTURES DETAILS ON LINE. THE COMPANY USES MISS LEADING AND FALSE ADVERTISING. YOU CANNOT CHARGE A PHONE WITHOUT A WIRE! YOU MUST PURCHASE AN ACCESSORY THAT LETS YOU CHARGE YOUR PHONE NOT USING THE WIRE THEY PROVIDE WITH THE UNIT. THAT IS A WASTE OF MONEY AND YOU WILL NOT BE HAPPY WITH THE PRODUCT. YOU MAY AS WELL JUST USE THE CHARGING DEVICE THAT CAME WITH THE PHONE!
customer_reviews.author: MR. FUN

product_meta.title: Powermat Home & Office Mat (Black) [Doors Sold Separately]
product_meta.description:
The Powermat Portable Mat wirelessly charges up to 3 devices at once. Simply Drop & Charge your favorite devices (receivers for devices sold seperatley).

AMAZON.COM
The Powermat Home and Office mat is a slim, sleek charging mat for home or office. What's a charging mat, you ask? Good question. Powermat's Wireless Charging System offers a clean, simple way to keep all those personal electronic devices charged, without a mess of cables. With the Powermat system, you choose a mat and then choose the receivers to match the devices you want to charge. Each mat includes a Universal Powercube receiver that allows you to charge hundreds of devices. You can also purchase receivers custom designed to fit on your devices, so you never need to remove them to use your device.

The Powermat Wireless Charging System provides a simple, fast and efficient way to keep all of your favorite personal electronic devices charged. Click to enlarge. 



THE POWERMAT WIRELESS CHARGING SYSTEM
Wireless Charging
Connect your devices to Powermat Receivers, and simply drop them on the Powermat to charge wirelessly, as fast or faster than the stock power adaptor. A unique sound lets you know a solid connection has been made (an additional sound is heard when you remove your device--both are adjustable and can be turned off), and an indicator light--also adjustable--is displayed while a device is charging. 

Use Only What You Need
Communication between the Powermat and Receivers allows the mat to give exactly enough power for exactly the right time. When a device is fully charged, power is shut off to that device, so no energy is wasted. If a device is used while on the mat, the system knows it--charging starts up again until you've got a full charge. 

Wired USB Connection
For legacy USB devices, or a quick charge while all your Receivers are in use, Powermats also feature a wired USB connection. It may not be wireless, but it's better than finding another free power outlet. 

A slim, sleek, charging mat for your home or office. Click to enlarge. 

Powercube Universal Receiver included. Click to enlarge. 

Eight tips to work with hundreds of devices. Click to enlarge. 

Get a custom fit receiver for certain devices. View all Powermat products. 

Slick Design
Industrial design is key for personal electronics, and the Powermat appropriately follows suit. The Home and Office Mat features a minimal curved design that will work in most any environment, while the fold-up Portable Mat looks sharp and stows away simply for travel. 

Powermat custom Receivers are like a second skin for the device they charge, enabling access to all controls and keeping the design clean and simple. Receivers are available for iPods and iPhones, Nintendo DS, various Blackberry models, and more. 

So How Does It Work?
Powermat utilizes principles of magnetic induction combined with Powermat proprietary patent-pending technology to safely and effectively provide power to electronic devices. Powermat transforms surfaces including walls, tables, floors and desktops into safe, simple, and efficient conductors of energy. It replaces the need to access multiple electrical sockets for real-time powering and charging of electronic devices. Neat, huh? 



POWERMAT HOME & OFFICE MAT
Slim, Sleek, Charging Mat for Home or Office
This mat wirelessly charges up to 3 Powermat-enabled devices simultaneously (and one more via the wired USB power port). It works with all Powermat receivers, and looks great in most any setting. 

Powermat Specifications


 * Charging Positions: 4 (3 wireless, 1 USB port) 
 * Dimensions: .625" x 12.25" x 4.5625" (HxWxD) 
 * Input Voltage: 100-240V AC, 50-60Hz Universal 
 * Output Voltage: 18VDC 
 * Output Current: 0.83A 
 * Standby Current: 0.011A 
 * Adapter Power: 15 Watts 

Universal Powercube
Included with the Home & Office Mat is the Powercube Universal Receiver. This receiver boasts eight interchangeable tips, allowing you to charge hundreds of mobile devices with just one unit. It works with all Powermats as well. 

The Powercube supplies universal, international power (100-240V). 

Finally, the Powercube features built-in cord management, and a tip storage compartment built right in, so you don't lose them. 

Powercube Receiver Compatibility (8 Tips Included)




Tip Charges These Devices Mini USB (default receiver tip)  * BlackBerry (all models that use Mini USB)
 * Many Motorola phones
 * Many HTC phones
 * Many Bluetooth headsets
 * Many GPS devices

Micro USB Tip  * Many Motorola phones
 * Many LG phones
 * Many Palm phones
 * Many Bluetooth headsets

Apple Tip  * iPod (all generations)
 * iPhone (all generations)

DS Lite Tip  * Nintendo DS Lite

DSi Tip  * Nintendo DSi

LG 1 Tip  * Many LG phones

Samsung 2 Tip  * Many Samsung phones

Sony PSP Tip  *  Playstation Portable
 * Some Kodak cameras

Additional tips can be purchased separately 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Powermat Home & Office Mat, Powermat Power Adapter, Powermat Powercube Universal Receiver, Tip Storage, Assorted Tips (8), Owner's Manual
feature_bullets: A simple, fast and efficient way to keep all of your personal electronic devices charged
Sleek, minimalist design that's perfect for home, office, and anywhere else you park your electronics
Four charging positions--three wireless, and one wired USB connector for charging a fourth device
Individual tone and light controls; doors sold seperately
Includes Universal Powercube with 8 interchangeable tips (Mini and Micro USB, Apple, Samsung, LG, Nintendo DS Lite and DSi, and Sony PSP)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.1 out of 5 stars137 ratings3.1 out of 5 stars
